title: This key/value pair shouldn't be in the json but be built by the program from user input
description:
This survey is meant for you to evaluate yourself and your partner for the project you just submitted together.

There will be one evaluation for each group project. At the end of the quarter, all the results will be combined in order to determine a "Group work" score that will count as part of your class grade. This score is totally independent from the grade you will receive from your related project submission.
assignment_group_id: This key/value pair shouldn't be in the json but be built by the program from user input

lock_at: This key/value pair shouldn't be in the json but be built by the program from user input

questions.question_text: I commit to complete this survey as fairly and honestly as possible

Self evaluation

First, let's start by evaluating yourself. Take the time to read all the questions, and their descriptions, and answer honestly.

Organization/planning

You had a role in the clerical organization of your group. For example you helped define the terms of your collaboration: how/when/where you should meet, how you should work together, etc.

Communication

You had a role in the communication of your group. For example, you helped maintain a constant communication with your partner throughout the project.

Teamwork/cooperation

You were willing to listen and respect the ideas of your partner, and discuss the work distribution. For example, you would not try to always impose your way of doing things.

Attitude

You showed positive and enthusiast attitude, and it was pleasant to work with you.

Contribution of ideas

You contributed ideas to the project in terms of how to tackle the assignment, structure the code, build certain algorithms, etc.

Contribution of code

You participated in the programming aspect of the project.

Additional comments

Please leave any additional comments about your participation here. This is optional.

Identify partner

Who is your partner?
questions.answers: This key/value pair shouldn't be in the json but be built by the program

questions.question_text:
Solo Submission Justification

If you did not submit with a partner, please explain why. If you spoke with me already about your reason, please put that here and whether or not I approved your reason. (If you did work with a partner, either (1) leave this question blank, or (2) put "I submitted with a partner".)

Partner evaluation

Now, let's evaluate your partner. Again, take the time to read all the questions, and their descriptions, and answer honestly.

Organization/planning

Your partner had a role in the clerical organization of your group. For example they helped define the terms of your collaboration: how/when/where you should meet, how you should work together, etc.

Communication

Your partner had a role in the communication of your group. For example, they helped maintain a constant communication with you throughout the project.

Teamwork/cooperation

Your partner were willing to listen and respect your ideas, and discuss the work distribution. For example, they would not try to always impose their way of doing things.

Attitude

Your partner showed positive and enthusiast attitude, and it was pleasant to work with them.

Contribution of ideas

Your partner contributed ideas to the project in terms of how to tackle the assignment, structure the code, build certain algorithms, etc.

Contribution of code

Your partner participated in the programming aspect of the project.

Additional comments

Please leave any additional comments about your partner's participation here. This is optional.

Project contribution

How would you quantify your and your partner's respective contribution to the project?

answers.answer_text: 0% vs 100% ==> Your partner did (almost) everything while you didn't do (almost) anything
25% vs 75% ==> Your partner contributed substantially more than you
50% vs 50% ==> You and your partner contributed (almost) equally
75% vs 25% ==> You contributed substantially more than your partner
100% vs 0% ==> You did (almost) everything while your partner didn't do (almost) anything
